item.title: Installing and running Node.js bin scripts
item.description: The package.json property "bin" lets an npm package specify which shell scripts it provides (for more information, see “Creating ESM-based shell scripts for Unix and Windows with Node.js”). If we install such a package, Node.js ensures that we can access these shell scripts (so-called bin scripts) from a command line. In this blog post, we explore two ways of installing packages with bin scripts:

item.title: Transformers-js - Neural Networks in the Browser
item.description: TL;DR I wrote a javascript library that lets you run modern transformer neural networks from Hugging Face 🤗 in the browser. It works on mobile browsers, desktop browsers, pretty much everywhere. Check out transformers-js on GitHub to see how it works and checkout out the live translation demo running on my static website: https://transformers-js.praeclarum.org.

item.title: Why SQLite? Why Now? 🐇
item.description:
I've been sucked down a sqlite rabbithole and I'm all-in on it. So why SQLite? And why now?
For me, its about re-architecting how we write code so it can fit the coming world of edge, dstributed and local-first computing.
In one way, sqlite is a great fit…
